newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian money market rates steady, trade livelier.
newsitem.headline: Croatian money market rates steady, trade livelier.

text.p: Croatian money market rates were steady in slightly livelier trade on Thursday, dealers said.
Morning trade exceeded 30 million kuna, the bulk in call money granted at a steady 10.5 percent.
Most of the rest in term loans -- some five million kuna -- were one-month facilities, granted at 15 percent, unchanged from established levels.
Borrowers sought another five million kuna this morning which could not be met, despite six million left on the supply side. Lenders and borrowers could not agree terms.
Overnight trade on Wednesday totalled 67.8 million kuna.
